com.clarionmedia.infinitum.di

Interface BeanDefinitionBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericBeanDefinitionBuilder

    public interface BeanDefinitionBuilder

    Provides a means to construct AbstractBeanDefinition instances. This can be used to dynamically build bean definitions with the purpose of registering them with a BeanFactory later.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 08/04/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • build

        AbstractBeanDefinition build()
        Builds the AbstractBeanDefinition instance.
        Returns:
        configured AbstractBeanDefinition

      • setName

        BeanDefinitionBuilder setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the bean name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to set
        Returns:
        BeanDefinitionBuilder to allow chaining

      • setType

        BeanDefinitionBuilder setType(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Sets the bean Class type.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to set
        Returns:
        BeanDefinitionBuilder to allow chaining

      • setProperties

        BeanDefinitionBuilder setProperties(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
        Sets the bean properties. These are Field-value pairs which can be injected into the bean.
        Parameters:
        properties - the bean properties to set
        Returns:
        BeanDefinitionBuilder to allow chaining

      • setScope

        BeanDefinitionBuilder setScope(java.lang.String scope)
        Sets the bean lifecycle scope. The singleton scope is used by default if this is not specified.
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope to set, such as prototype or singleton
        Returns:
        BeanDefinitionBuilder to allow chaining
